intro: Leria dentata, commonly known as the toothed leria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some parts of the world for its attractive foliage and blooms.
